Posts.Content: Just received my biopsy result, all were Benign!!! Thanks so much to those who responded and thanks to all who participate in this forum and provided such invaluable information and insights.. keep the faith!!!
Posts.Title: awaiting biopsy results, looking for RAP surgeon recco in Jax, Fla and NYC

Posts.Content: this site has been invaluable to me, so thanks to all who have contributed... I am 58. My dad, his brother and their uncle all died as a result of prostate cancer in their 80's. Have been diligent with PSA, DRE and Urine workups.. -PSA has been .4 or .5 for more than 15 years -small prostate 30 cc. -No real problems with urination, etc.. -All very good until... Lumps discovered on DRE in January. MRI was taken as part of fusion biopsy. MRI report says Lesions in both nodules: -left is 15mm by 10mm, "characteristics are highly concerning for malignancy", "capsular disruption suspected and potential invasion into seminal vessel" -also a smaller lesion 4mm by 4mm may or may not be part of larger one. -right is 9mm by 5mm with the same characteristics of larger left lesion. Fusion biposy done 5 days ago -30 samples taken 16 from lesions and 14 general. -should have results in another week or so... Concerned would be an understatement!!! Having watched my dad go through this I vowed to get this out of me if I ever had any inkling of cancer.. I know I am getting ahead of myself but have two questions: -does anyone have any experience with procedures in Jacksonville Florida that they can share.. I live very near the Mayo clinic.. -the same question about NYC, I have relations at Memorial Sloan but would take a view on docs there and anywhere else in NYC -has anyone had similar results to mine, ie such a low psa and had cancer? Thanks to all...
Posts.Title: awaiting biopsy results, looking for RAP surgeon recco in Jax, Fla and NYC
